item.title: Rubbish dumped in the alleyway/path, 4th November
item.description:
Rubbish dumped in the alleyway. Reported already but not actioned. Please note, this path/alleyway is maintained by Bexley Council including the shrubs next to the rubbish. It is supposed to be maintained as well as litter pick done but it is very rare. Next to the lamp post.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Darenth Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Possible dumped vehicle, 3rd November
item.description:
This particular car has been in the same spot outside no.68 Castlewood Drive for at least the last 5 to 6 weeks without moving, it has a flat front tyre and some scratches and dark patch marks on the bodywork

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlewood Drive, Shooters Hill, London

item.title: Damamged metal fence, 3rd November
item.description:
The metal fence has been damaged for some time and appears to have been hit by a vehicle. The damaged section poses a safety hazard to children, pets, and wildlife in the area due to sharp metal edges. Immediate repair is required to prevent potential injuries or further damage. Please arrange for inspection and repair as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Christchurch Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
This has been like this after building works in Holburne road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holburne Road, Kidbrooke, London

item.title: Antisocial behaviour at the overflowing bins, 3rd November
item.description:
As the issue of the overflowing bins and constant fly tipping at Northfield House has not been resolved for some time, the bins have now began to attract individuals taking drugs and going through the bin bags, suitcases and other items left around the bins. As a resident of Northfield, I'm beginning to feel unsafe in addition to the serious health and safety concerns.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Park Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken drain causing loud bangs and vibrations through the house when large vehicles drive over it, 3rd November
item.description:
Since the road was resurfaced in the last year or so, the drain level is now a fair amount below the surface of the road. This is causing a loud noise and vibrations in the house every time a bus, lorry, fire engine etc goes over it after leaving the roundabout. This is happening several times an hour. Please review and rectify this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive rat infestation, 3rd November
item.description:
There is a hole in the ground that has not been filled in for several months now, and it now appears to be a rat's nest. I have passed this hole while waiting for the bus and while walking along the pavement, and have on separate occasions seen multiple rats moving around inside and going into the hole. It is a health and safety hazard and requires urgent attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Creek Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering and leaves, 3rd November
item.description:
No one seems to be cleaning our street on a regular basis anymore - it has been like this for the last 6 months. We need a regular street cleaner, itâ€™s a mess out there - full of litter and leaves. Please find a long term solution.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tottenham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Osborne Road needs more electric charging point on lamp post to help residents who have disabled electric vehicles to be able to charge car.Electric Charging Station. There is only one electronic charging station on Osborne Road and there is multiple vehicles who use it. Hackney Council need to invest more money in electric charging point bays Osborne Road. I am a resident on Semley gate Road and have an electric vehicle. I have also got a permit for Z55 area where I park the car. The closest (only) charging station available is on this semley gate but only permit holders K can use it. I need somewhere to charge my car. If the council do not install more electronic charging ports on Osborne Road it will cause a divide and frustration amongst motorist. There has been an incident in Hackney where one motorist left his car on charged for a whole day. The motorist of this zip higher car was being selfish hogging the charging station point up in Hackney another motorist took the law into his own hands and served justice on this selfish charging hog. Another motorist was unable to use the charging point because of this selfish driver occupying charging points so the other motorists smashed and vandalised the vehicle. The motorist smashed all the windows on the higher car and even smash the side mirrors. This is why hackney council have to put more charging points in because it is causing road rage, vandalism because not everyone can use the charging points. Please Hackney Council do something about this. You have time to invest in line bikes and allocate bay for antisocial behavior line bikes. why not allocate more charging bay, points for residents cars., 3rd November
item.description:
Please help hackney council invest more in charging points for residents on Osborne road.Relax the road rage and vandalism being caused by frustrated motorists. This was shocking to see.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Semley Gate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep hole in grass verge (possibly from a removed tree)., 3rd November
item.description:
The hole has been there for sometime. However when children are coming home from Bursted Wood School and there are adults, children, pushchairs, scooters etc - pedestrians are forced onto the verge. Today my foot went down the hole and I fell, badly twisting my ankle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Windermere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
